Florida Skimboarding Pro/Am Tournament Share Annual Events Florida’s Historic Coast has an annual calendar chock full of events that appeal to a wide variety of interests. Editor's Note: Please call to confirm before driving long distances as some times and details may vary. The following are just a sampling of some of the most popular events in St. Augustine, Ponte Vedra & The Beaches. ONGOING: First Friday Art Walk First Friday Every Month From 5-9 p.m. on the first Friday of every month, new exhibits, music, entertainment and refreshments are featured at over 20 galleries in St. Augustine. Learn More January Jimmy Jam BBQ Slam & Car Show Outstanding BBQ competition, classic cars, cornhole championships, live music, arts and crafts – this event has it all! Learn More Saint Augustine Film Festival The St. Augustine Film Festival presents more than 20 outstanding films with filmmakers’ panel discussions. Learn More Matanzas 5000 5K & Fun Run One of Florida’s fastest 5K races on a scenic USATF-certified course. Learn More February Flight to Freedom Flight to Freedom recreates the experience of the hundreds of slaves who traveled to Fort Mose in search of freedom… Learn More Fort Mose Jazz & Blues Series Grammy Award-Winning Jazz and Blues Artists perform over the two week series. Learn More St. Augustine Spanish Food & Wine Festival Various food & wine events over two days, showcasing the Spanish influence on the culinary scene in St. Augustine. Learn More March Searle’s Sack of St. Augustine This authentic reenactment portrays Captain Robert Searle’s 1668 attack on St. Augustine to loot the silver ingots held in the… Learn More St. Augustine Celtic Music & Heritage Festival Did you know St. Augustine is America’s oldest Celtic city? The ancient city hosted the original St. Patrick Parade in… Learn More THE PLAYERS Championship Come see your favorite golf pros compete at the world-famous PLAYERS Stadium Course at TPC Sawgrass in Ponte Vedra Beach… Learn More St. Augustine Lions Seafood Festival Good food and good times for a great cause. Enjoy this weekend festival filled with live music, vendors and delictable… Learn More April Florida’s Birding & Photo Fest One of the most popular events among birding, nature, and photography enthusiasts in the southeast will take place on Florida’s… Learn More Cabbage, Potato and Bacon Festival Come celebrate Hastings' rich agricultural heritage with a weekend filled with delicious food, live music, family-friendly activities, Lawn Mower races… Learn More Blessing of the Fleet This annual event has watercraft from trawlers, yachts, sailboats and motor craft all decorated to receive a blessing from the… Learn More St. Augustine Easter Parade St. Augustine’s Easter Parade features marching bands, floats, drill teams, the Easter Bunny, and the St. Augustine Royal Family with… Learn More Taste of St. Augustine Celebrate 25+ years of culinary excellence, local flavor, and community spirit—all while supporting a great cause! Learn More May St. Augustine Food & Wine Festival A culinary weekend celebration at World Golf Village with celebrity guest chefs, winemakers and beverage experts in spirits and beers… Learn More Annual Craft Brewer’s Fest Great food, great music and great craft brews. What can be better? Enjoy unlimited samples from more than 25 local… Learn More Drake’s Raid The English corsair Sir Francis Drake and his raiders return to St. Augustine in an authentic recreation of the 158… Learn More May through September Every Wednesday Music by The Sea Concert Series Every Wednesday evening through September, a free live concert takes place from 7-9 p.m. at the St. Johns County Ocean… Learn More Every Thursday Concerts in the Plaza Throughout the summer months, every Thursday evening a free live concert takes place from 6-8 p.m. in St. Augustine’s historic… Learn More June St. Augustine Music Festival The St. Augustine Music Festival is a series of six free concerts held throughout two weekends in the historic Cathedral… Learn More Battle of Bloody Mose This annual reenactment of the June 26, 1740, Battle of Bloody Mose, a pivotal battle between the British and… Learn More July July 4th St. Augustine Fireworks and Concert The All Star Orchestra performs in the Plaza de la Constitucion then one of the largest fireworks displays on the… Learn More Ancient City Kingfish Challenge This exciting competition offers cash and prizes for the biggest catch. This annual tournament takes place from the St. Augustine… Learn More August Florida Skimboarding Pro/​Am Tournament August 2026 Every August on Vilano Beach, the Florida Skimboarding Pro/Am Tournament draws athletes from around the world to showcase their skills… Learn More September St. Augustine Founder’s Day Celebration This day honors the founding of America’s First Parish, the Cathedral of St. Augustine, and St. Augustine, the nation’s oldest… Learn More Sing Out Loud Festival One of the largest music celebration in Florida offering hundreds of live performances at multiple venues throughout St. Augustine and… Learn More October St. Augustine Greek Festival Celebrate all things Greek - food, dancing, music and heritage - at this annual festival celebrating St. Augustine’s Greek heritage… Learn More Halloween You won’t find a more haunted Halloween destination than the Nation’s oldest city, St. Augustine, Florida. Learn More November Whiskey, Wine & Wildlife Whiskey, Wine & Wildlife celebrates the best of St. Augustine's Vilano Beach and Florida's Historic Coast, from its culinary superstars… Whiskey, Wine & Wildlife Festival Ponte Vedra Auto Show The Ponte Vedra Auto Show showcases classic and new collectors' cars from 9 a.m.-3 p.m. The auto show and parking… Learn More Mid-November through January Nights of Lights Selected by National Geographic Traveler as one of the ten best holiday lighting displays in the world, St. Augustine glows… Learn More December St. Augustine Christmas Parade St. Augustine’s Annual Christmas Parade, the largest in North Florida, includes floats, marching bands, horses and the arrival of Santa… Learn More Garden Club Christmas Tour of Homes This annual tour showcases holiday decorations at a selection of St. Augustine’s most outstanding private homes. Enjoy a taste of… Learn More Regatta of Lights Brilliantly lighted boats glide through St. Augustine’s Matanzas Bay between the Bridge of Lions and Castillo de San Marcos during… Learn More Light Up the NIGHT! New Year’s Eve Firework Show Kick off the New Year in seaside style at this St. Augustine Beach event! Enjoy fireworks, festivities and food. OUR TEAM | CAMP top of page Home ABOUT OUR TEAM JOIN THE TEAM PROGRAMS TACT URBAN ARTS NORTHERN LIGHTS BLUEGRASS MUSIC CAMP GIRLS ROCK THE NORTH YOUTH MUSIC CAMPS RESIDENCIES CULTURAL FOUNDATIONS MUSIC IN SCHOOLS ARTS EXPLORATION TOUR SOA FIDDLE MENTORSHIP CURRICULUM DEVELOPMENT HIP HOP COLLABORATION MUSIC TEACHER MENTORSHIP CONTACT NEWS DOYLEFEST LINEUP AND TICKETS ABOUT GET INVOLVED GALLERY CONTACT PAST PERFORMERS DONATE Our Team. Rooted in the arts. Experts in various fields, working together to share their talents in communities across Saskatchewan. Eliza Doyle managingdirector@communityartsmentorship.com Co - Founder / Managing Director Eliza is a professional musician, songwriter and recording artist, teacher, community advocate, leader and is the co-founder behind Saskatchewan’s arts organization, C.A.M.P; Community Arts Mentorship Program. Her focus on fostering the arts while supporting local community capacity to deliver arts programming has been welcomed throughout communities in Saskatchewan. Offering services to remote and under-served communities presents new challenges, and all of CAMP programming serves to mitigate these obstacles. Familiar with the arts and music industry in Saskatchewan, she also aims to provide the opportunity and mentorship available to people with challenges in access due to location and lack of resources. Holly Rae Yuzicapi culturalengagement@communityartsmentorship.com Co - Founder / Cultural Consultant The co-founder of CAMP and a proud Dakota/Lakota from the Standing Buffalo Dakota Nation in Treaty 4 Territory, Saskatchewan.  Holly grew up in the beautiful Qu'Appelle valley.  Coming from a large family, Holly has been able to observe and learn from many generations of the Goodwill and Yuzicapi families.  The strength of her sense of identity was nurtured and shaped by her family and community.  Without realizing it at the time, Holly started doing cultural arts sharing from a young age which really is rooted in participating in powwow dancing and attending other cultural events on a regular basis.  She has evolved into an independent natural materials artist that loves to facilitate cultural arts engagement opportunities to all audiences.  Holly is proud of how she was raised and is very thankful for all that her family has taught her.  Respectfully representing the spirit and potential of those teachings is why Holly does the work that she does.  It is how she chooses to honour her family. LJ Tyson Kimbley innovationliaison@communityartsmentorship.com Innovation Liaison LJ Tyson is a singer-songwriter from Prince Albert, Saskatchewan. The has used his identity as inspiration for creating lyrics and melodies. LJ has had music played across Canada and beyond. His latest release Home On A Rainbow was critically acclaimed and awarded a prize from SOCAN TD Indigenous Songwriter Awards. LJ currently works as Innovation Liaison for Community Arts mentorship program, bringing music to remote and underserved communities. Steph Cameron administrativedirector@communityartsmentorship.com Administrative Director Saskatchewan-based artist Steph Cameron has gained recognition for her unique take on contemporary Americana music, lively instrumentation, and captivating lyrics. From her early days of busking, she has become an internationally touring professional recording artist. Her critically acclaimed debut album, Sad-Eyed Lonesome Lady, released on Pheromone Recordings in 2014, was nominated for the Polaris Music Prize and praised as the #1 Canadian album of that year by PopMatters, while No Depression called it "a stunning debut." This success led her to join the Paquin Artist Agency and embark on national tours. Her expertise in performing is the real world experience CAMP participants benefit the most from . Zoe Slusar programcoordinator@communityartsmentorship.com Program Coordinator Zoe Slusar was the voice actress for Kid Goku in the English dubs of the Dragon Ball and Dragon Ball GT anime, done by Blue Water Studios. She also provided the voice of Sai Saici in Kidou Butouden G Gundam, as well as the video game Gundam: Battle Assault 2.

Zoe also voiced the character Jungo in the Flemish created series.

Zoe, also known by her stage name ZHE the Free, released her first rap EP album titled The Love EP in September 2020. This album charted #1 on 90.9 CJSW in Calgary, Alberta in November 2020. Mitchell Dureault programcoordinator@communityartsmentorship.com Program Coordinator Mitch Dureault is a seasoned professional music instructor and traditional musician, who comes from the Treaty 4 Territory of the southern Saskatchewan prairies. Currently sitting as a board member, and working instructor for C.A.M.P., Mitch is an advocate for the arts and has a strong focus on decolonizing his own music & teaching practices. He regularly draws from his B.A. in International Studies while working with and aiding organisations, communities, and schools in the development and implementation of equitable and continual art programming throughout the province. Mitch is also very passionate about the promotion and preservation of the local culture of Saskatchewan fiddling and has been making efforts to visit and interview as many fiddlers as possible from across the province for his Saskatchewan Fiddle History Project, a multi-year project in which he collects stories, tunes, and histories from these individuals in an attempt to preserve and document the ever evolving diverse intricacies of the provinces fiddling culture. Jille Shotton communications@communityartsmentorship.com sponsorship@communityartsmentorship.com​ Marketing and Communications Director\ Sponsorship Jille Shotton joined the Community Arts Mentorship Program in 2024 as the Marketing and Communications Director, bringing a decade of experience in festival marketing, promotions, and community building within Saskatchewan's arts and culture sector. Her background includes managing marketing, communications, sponsorship, and onsite operations for events such as the Northern Lights Bluegrass & Old Time Music Festival, Winterruption, Ness Creek Music Festival, Fiddlyness, Shivering Strings and the Children's Festival of Saskatchewan. Jille is passionate about strengthening communities through the arts, having organized open jams, Bluegrass Brunch, radio shows, and various events and festivals. Her work focuses on creating inclusive, vibrant spaces where the community can connect and thrive. Lillanohna Naytowhowcon President LILI, an Indigenous singer, songwriter, and recording artist hailing from Sturgeon Lake First Nation in Saskatchewan, blends her passion for music and independent songwriting. She is actively engaged in community projects that celebrate and honour Indigenous culture through a fusion of traditional Cree songs, indie rock, folk, hip-hop, and dance music. In 2024, expect the release of her music under the esteemed blessed-street record label, marking a significant chapter in her musical journey. The album includes collaboration with recording artist Lancelot Knight in Six Underwater, showcasing her versatility. Proudly identifying as a nehiyaw iskwew, she seamlessly weaves her creative pursuits into a traditional lifestyle, contributing to a First Nation Healing Lodge under the guidance of elders and knowledge keepers. The past year has been a transformative period characterized by healing and growth, with her music echoing the spirit of loss, hope, and perseverance. Her vocal style is both distinctive and heartfelt, drawing inspiration from grassroots music festivals, independent artists, and the eclectic vibes of the city. A nomadic spirit with a touch of witchy charm, LILI invites all to partake in the enchantment of her melodies. Travis Beatty Board Member Travis Beatty is from Timber Bay, Saskatchewan and is instrumentalist. He has a studio in Saskatoon, Saskatchewan called Rez Rat Recording, and is passionate about helping community and youth in Saskatchewan. He joined the CAMP Sask Arts Board of Directors in October 2023, and we are very lucky to have him! JOIN THE MAILING LIST SIGN UP NOW Thanks to our supporting organizations Email: managingdirector@communityartsmentorship.com Tel: 306-774-5888 bottom of page

Immerse yourself in authentic Greek culture and heritage October 7th and 8th at the Holy Trinity Greek Orthodox Church of St. Augustine during the 25th Annual Greek Festival! Transport your senses to Greece as you taste authentic homemade foods, drinks and pastries. This is a FREE event, open to the public. Take out or eat in and enjoy the festivities... or better yet, eat in AND take out to enjoy later. Click here for more information about this activity Please help us keep this calendar up to date! If this activity is sold out, canceled, or otherwise needs alteration, email mindy@kidsoutandabout.com so we can update it immediately. If you have a question about the activity itself, please contact the organization administrator listed below. Explore the online menu to begin your Greek culinary journey. For one weekend, surround yourself with the sounds of Greek music, enjoy live performances and participate in traditional Greek folk dancing. The 25th annual event also features an arts and crafts market showcasing Greek products as well as handcrafted items created by local artists, artisans and makers. And, you can even take a guided church tour and attend Sunday morning liturgy. This is a FREE event, open to the public. Festival hours are Saturday from 11 a.m. to 7 p.m. and Sunday from noon to 6 p.m. Pre-ordering for whole specialty pans is now available. Click here to order pans online now. Then, pick-up via drive thru at Holy Trinity Greek Orthodox Church on Friday, October 6th between 4 and 7 p.m. St. Augustine Greek Festival *Times, dates, and prices of any activity posted to our calendars are subject to change. Please be sure to click through directly to the organization’s website to verify. Organization: St. Augustine Greek Festival Location: 2940 County Road 214 Saint Augustine , FL , 32084 United States See map: Google Maps Phone: 904-829-0504 Contact name: Information Email address: staugustinegreekfest@gmail.com Click for more information The event has already taken place on this date: 10/08/2023 Time: PAN PICK UP ONLY: Friday, October 6th between 4 and 7 p.m. | Saturday 11AM-7PM | Sunday 12PM-6PM Price: FREE Ages All Ages Adults & kids together Adults without kids Tags: Event Celebration Festival/fair Food event Food festival (barbecue, food truck rodeo, winery celebration, etc) Performance Concert Arts Outdoors Arts: Performance Nature/Outdoors Web Service Pinterest Share on Facebook Tweet Widget Featured in Jacksonville Celebrating local experiences across North America To provide parents with all of the information they need to help them and their kids get "out and about" to fantastic opportunities for fun, education, and cultural enrichment in our area. To celebrate and share information on the many splendid artistic, cultural and recreational activities available to residents of cities across the US and Canada. AUGUSTINE FESTIVALS ST. AUGUSTINE CELTIC MUSIC & HERITAGE FESTIVAL LIGHT-UP! NIGHT ST. AUGUSTINE ST. AUGUSTINE NIGHTS OF LIGHTS Nights of Lights Tours CITY BLOG St. Augustine Greek Festival Photos provided by Greek Festival Facebook page Mark Your Calendar Date: October 11 & 12, 2025 Time: Saturday: 11:00am-9:00pm Sunday:   12:00pm-5:00pm Location: Holy Trinity Greek Orthodox Church Visit The Wesbite Get Directions About St. Augustine Greek Festival Immerse yourself in Greek culture and heritage at this annual event celebrating All Things Greek … authentic Greek food, pastry, music, dancing and more! There are plenty of shopping opportunities at the Holy Trinity Agora (market), St. Theodora’s Gift Shop and Bookstore, and the Zaharoplastio (for pastries and treats to take home!) Stop by the Kafenio where they will be serving up Greek frappes and friendly bartenders will have plenty of ouzo lemonada, beer and wine available for purchase. It’s a great way to experience and celebrate Greek Culture and Heritage! Photos provided by Greek Festival Facebook page Greek Food The Greek food offered at the festival has ranged from appetizers to desserts … and even Greek liquor.  All delicious!  Meals have started with the traditional Greek salad, then you choose from entrees like roasted lamb or moussaka (similar to shepherd’s pie but with eggplant and béchamel sauce).  Or, festival goers could opt for an item off the grill like a gyro or pork or chicken Souvlaki dinner or sandwich. Afterward, take your pick from baklava (a filo pastry with walnuts and spice and topped with honey), kataifi (rolled shredded filo filled with walnuts and dipped in honey), melomakarona (honey dipped spice cookies with ground nuts), and a variety of other tasty pastries for dessert.   Of course, you could eat your dessert there or take it home … if it made it that far. Photos provided by Greek Festival Facebook page Places to Stay Back to Festivals Disclaimer: Every effort is made to ensure the accuracy of the information in this article. search Menü Team At the Oeko-Institut, we work on an interdisciplinary basis in a team of more than 200 staff. About Cookies This website uses cookies that process personal data. Some are technically necessary in order to offer you our website without errors or to save your data protection preferences. Other cookies are only set by us after your consent and are used to evaluate and optimize the website. We use the services of YouTube to display videos. You can revoke your consent at any time on the Privacy page with effect for all future visits. Find more information regarding cookies in our Data Protection Declaration Mandatory These cookies are needed for a smooth operation of our website.                                                             year Type HTML Provider TYPO3 fe_typo_user Purpose Assigns your browser to a session on the server. Lifetime session Type HTTP Provider Website Spendino Purpose Spendino Lifetime session Type Connection Provider GRÜN Software/spendino Mandatory Analysis We analyze visits to the website in a fully privacy-compliant and anonymized manner using Matomo cookieless tracking. In this consent banner, we ask you to allow us to perform further analysis by setting cookies. This enables us to evaluate data on repeated visits to the page. _pk_id Purpose Used to store a few details about the user such as the unique visitor ID. Lifetime 13
                                                            months Type HTML Provider Matomo (selbstgehostet) _pk_ses Purpose Short lived cookie used to temporarily store data for the visit. YouTube Purpose We use YouTube, which sets cookies, uses browser storage, and also transfers personal data to YouTube. The service loads additional Google services as needed, such as fonts, and transfers your user behavior to the provider Google. Contact St. Augustine's Centre: Discover our contact details, location, and how to join our mailing list. Skip to main content I Need Help English English Classes Podcast Advice and Support Asylum and Immigration Housing Health Families and Children Refugee Move On Activities Events and Trips Sports Arts & Music Befriending Cycle Club Chill Out Room Other ways we help Food Free Shop and Salon I Can Help Donate Jobs Volunteer Partner With Us Fundraise Campaign Latest News and Stories Podcasts Content Library About What We Do Our Funders Safeguarding Find Us Donate Now Search Contact Subscribe × Search the site Search for: × Contact St Augustine's Centre Your Name (Required) First Last Your Phone (Required) Your Email (Required) Your Enquiry (Required) CAPTCHA URL This field is for validation purposes and should be left unchanged. × Subscribe to our Newsletter CAPTCHA Email Address Contact us info@staugustinescentrehalifax.org.uk St Augustine’s Centre Hanson Lane Halifax HX1 5PG what3words: ///pumps.popped.fallen For general enquiries please call 01422 352492. We are open Monday-Thursday 9:30am – 3:30pm. For advice and support, come along to our advice drop-in on Tuesday, Wednesday and Thursday, from 9.30 – 11.30am. How to find us By bike Please use the Google Map at the top of this page for directions. Use the postcode HX1 5PG. We have bike racks you can use. They are behind the fence near the containers. Please speak to reception if you need help. By bus If you are travelling by bus to Halifax, you can walk from the bus station, please look at the Google Map at the top of this page for directions. Alternatively, you can take bus 21 from Halifax directly to St Augustine’s Centre. The bus leaves Market Street, stand number 15, every half an hour in the direction of Pellon. The bus takes 7 minutes. You should get off the bus on it’s 6th stop, called Hanson Lane Bowman Grove. This bus stop is opposite St Augustine’s Centre. By car We have some car parking spaces and road side parking. We recommend you park your car on the road in front of the centre. Our postcode for your SatNav is HX1 5PG. Please use the Google Map at the top of this page for directions. By train It’s a 30 minute walk from Halifax train station to St Augustine’s Centre. Or a 10 minute taxi ride for about £5. Walk straight forward from the train station up the hill on Horton Street. When you get to the Victoria Theatre continue on Fountain Street. The road bears to the right, then you reach Barum Top roundabout. At the roundabout walk forward on Cow Green. When you reach the traffic lights in front of New Ebeneezer Church turn left and walk up the hill on Pellon Lane. Continue on this road for 0.3 miles, then turn left on Hanson Lane. Continue on Hanson Lane for 0.4 miles, continue on the road at the roundabout. Our centre is on the right just after Bowman Grove. The building nearest the road is our Support Building. The building set back behind the fence is our Activities Building. Accessibility Interpreters available, so please ask. We have an access ramp into our centre grounds and the ground floors in both our Support building and Activities building are accessible. There is an accessible toilet in our Support building. Please let us know if you have any specific access needs and we will always try meet your needs. Contact info@staugustinescentrehalifax.org.uk 01422 352492 St Augustine’s Centre Hanson Lane Halifax HX1 5PG Send us a message Quick links Jobs Volunteer Financial Report 2023 Articles of Association (Governance) Site Credits Privacy Statement Cookie Policy Accreditation St. Augustine’s Centre, Halifax is a company limited by guarantee (number 06819800) and a registered charity (number 1131784) St. Augustine’s Centre, Halifax is regulated in the UK by the IAA with the authorisation number N201900079 MyLivingWage accreditation: 3 August 2023 ILPA member: 9056 AgencyForGood Copyright 2025. All Rights Reserved
